top.title: South Korea's ex-president jailed for life over martial law attempt
top.summary: Yoon Suk Yeol's December 2024 martial law bid fundamentally damaged South Korea's democracy, a judge told the court.

top.title: Sudan atrocities are 'hallmarks of genocide', UN says
top.summary: A UN fact-finding mission issued the report after investigating the capture of el-Fasher by the Rapid Support Forces.

top.title: White House presses Iran to make deal, while ramping up military presence
top.summary: US media reports that Trump has discussed attack options with advisers, and a  strike could happen as early as Saturday.

top.title: Tech firms will have 48 hours to remove abusive images under new law
top.summary: The government is proposing that intimate image abuse should be treated more severely.

top.title: Bill Gates pulls out of India's AI summit over Epstein files controversy
top.summary: The Gates Foundation said the decision was made to "ensure the focus remains on the summit's key priorities".

top.title: Zuckerberg defends Meta in landmark social media addiction trial
top.summary: The billionaire boss said he "always" regretted not making faster progress to identify users under 13.

title.#text: The RAM shortage is coming for everything you care about
The biggest app in the whole wide world
Mark Zuckerberg and his Ray-Ban entourage have their day in court
